website_summaries.verdict: Newest model with 550-pound pull string para-cord leash. Great way to exercise and increase energy especially for active dogs.
pros: Made with high grade carbon steel
Jerkease leash attachment and pet harness are a nice perk
Reinvigorates and increases interest in dog exercising
cons: Clasp and tether seem short but can be remedied
May be challenging for dogs who don't know how to walk on a leash
Bungee cord inside metal tube could fray over long term use

customer_reviews.title: Ideal for chronic pullers/doggie athletes
customer_reviews.text: I have an extremely high drive German shorthaired pointer that I just bought it to run her into shape for hunting season. This dog is unwalkable. She pulls even on no pull harnessing. She’s like driving a Ferrari in a parade. Complete frustration. Anyway, I tried this out for the first time yesterday and she did great. Went a mile and half to get acclimated to it. She tried to pull one time when she wanted to chase geese but I barely felt it on the bike and she kept trucking. This product is the best thing I’ve ever bought for my pup. This is a complete game changer for us.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Stark

customer_reviews.title: Buy This!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a game changer. My husky used to be able to pull when a squirrel ran and I was always concerned he would get hit by a car while biking beside me. This leash holds the dog very close to the bike and it mounts under the seat, so the body weight of the rider adds more stability and control over the dog if they decide to see an animal and start chasing. Bike rides with my dog have now become a daily event and I tell all my friends and family who are interested in biking with their dog to buy this product. Amazing.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Real stainless steel heavy duty. Exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.author: marco apostolico

customer_reviews.title: Get this!!! I’m extremely happy with the Walky Dog!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! This is the best item I have ever purchased on Amazon. I have a 10 month old Chocolate Lab who is full of energy. It took less then 5 min to get her comfortable with the Walky Dog. I had her at a full gallop next to me. This is definitely a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle J. Emmi

customer_reviews.title: A "figure it out yourself" product
customer_reviews.text: In the Q&A section, one person asked if this is good for all sizes of dogs. The answer was yes, but it's not. I have a 20 lb. and 30 lb. dogs, and this is too high for either. I guess I have to buy some sort of attachment to lower it. Another person asked if you need to buy anything else with this. The answer was no. The real answer is yes. You have to buy a harness to go with it, and unless you have a big dog, you need to buy something to make it lower. The box came with NO instructions, so it's up to you to assemble this without any guidance.
customer_reviews.author: English Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Need reinforcing
customer_reviews.text: The concept is awesome and the bar and bike attachment are great. What I had issues with was the strength of the cord. I was very concerned it was not going to hold up and then I would have a loose dog. So I ended up taking the whole thing apart and reinforcing the cord that connects from the bar to the dogs harness. It was easy to do because of my fantastic friendship bracelet skills I was able to braid and wrap the cord to make it much stronger. However, I feel like you shouldn’t have to do all this work. They should give a nice strong cord to begin with.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing product. Bought in 2014 and I use it almost daily. It keeps my dog well under control and I feel confident biking with her even while pregnant (I’ve used it through 3 pregnancies, with a child bike seat on the back and while towing a trailer!) we have a couple of the extra attachments so that we can easily switch it between bikes. It could not be simpler. I added a short bungee cord onto the end to give my dog a bit more leash which worked well for us.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Works good....need to work with my dog for familiarizing him with it
customer_reviews.text: Some folks really liked this and their pooches seem to tolerate it well enough. My dog is a bit more skittish but I will be working with him to familiarize him with it so he doesn't seem so nervous. It is very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not recommend. Used once and never again.
customer_reviews.text: The Walku doggy is not for all dogs. In case of mine she feels very uncomfortable being so close to the wheel of the bike. And seeing how much she disliked it it wasn’t worth using anymore. I even went over all the advice and videos on the website. Didn’t matter one bit. Even when I’ve screwed the bar on as tight as possible with a wrench it still moved around a bit. Honestly do not think this is safe at all. And definitely not for use on the road or sidewalk. My walku dog has been in its box ever since. Definitely would not recommend to any of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: nagisa otsubo

customer_reviews.title: We are crazy people with 2 Springer puppies AND a Husky
customer_reviews.text: Having two littermate Springer's and a husky means a lot of energy to burn out. This system allows for me to run two dogs at once with a Wally Dog on each side of my seat post. Then my husband hooks the husky up to his bike and we ride the neighborhood. These are a great distance so the dogs can't get wrapped up in my feet or tires etc. Given our dogs are shorter I do wish the leash built in was extendable so we could adjust between the dogs without third party extenders. Having the leash detach so easily from the bike is a very appreciated feature for me running both in tandem. Attaching and detaching is easy!!
customer_reviews.author: Ambear406

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for our dog.
customer_reviews.text: This is extremely subjective. We did watch the video. The dog we hooked this up was able to pull forward enough to the point that he could hit the front tire with his mouth. To be fair, we might not have been doing it right, but we really can't figure out what we should have done differently.
customer_reviews.author: Emt

customer_reviews.title: Decent. Cool idea. Wish it didn’t move much on my seat post. Not safe
customer_reviews.text: Should come with a longer rope attachment. As tight as it is, it still moves forward or back while on the trail with my big dog. UPDATE*** I am downgrading my review and will be returning the product, it constantly moves back and forth on my seat post, the cord that came with it is way too short, it is dangerous, more and more I think about it. Not just dangerous for myself, but for my dog as well!!!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rolla

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: It's useless and dangers for your dog. It's too short and dog can easily get injured.
customer_reviews.author: James Salinger

customer_reviews.title: NoHo Hank says "It is OK, but not very great"
customer_reviews.text: (and if you don't know who Hank is, you need to start watching Barry on HBO STAT!): So like I bought this to exercise my dog Christobal on worlds most best bike, Cannondale Adventure 2. I was seriously confused when foot was smashed between bar and pedal over and over, like famous Chechnya torture machine. I'm like a total gearhead and this looked a million times cool. But now I'm super totally bummed. Maybe owners should tell people some bikes will not like this. Yeah, I think that is fair idea.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Milone

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, Bad application
customer_reviews.text: The idea is good but by mounting the "Walky Dog" on my road bike I lose sight of my dog and even though I tightened the clamp around the seat post with strong pressure it still slipped rearward, putting my dog even further out of sight & closer to the rear wheel. Today I used my "Mighty Paw Hands Free Dog Leash, Premium Running Dog Leash, Lightweight Reflective Bungee Dog Leash" (48" bungee) & it worked very well.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Sarver

customer_reviews.title: We bike every day!
customer_reviews.text: We take our German Shepherd and Lab/Sharpei mix biking every day. We go 2+ miles each time. Our girls get going into a full gallop sometimes!! The lab mix is 74 lbs, very muscled and strong. She can pull pretty hard when she sees another dog and we are still not pulled off the bike. The only negative? We humans don't get much exercise as the girls pull us along quite a bit, so we don't pedal a lot!! 🤣 Best way to exercise your dogs! We can't recommend it highly enough.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Deems

customer_reviews.title: Great to use on a high energy dog!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to help exercise our 115 lb German Shepard...he has more energy than me. He loves it! We take him out for about 10-15 min bike ride, he gets to run as fast as he likes, actually I do not have to pedal;) The vet said he is in great physical shape and I attribute the bike rides.He is more relaxed and his nails do not need trimming. This leash keeps your hands on the handlebars and your dog to your side and not able to run in front of the whee. It makes for an enjoyable ride. Not sure how it would work for smaller dogs but wonderful for the bigger guys.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: I am genuinely surprised and elated with this device. I have a highly excitable German Shorthaired Pointer who is notorious for pulling me around on a leash and I am rather petite. She’s able to enjoy a run and she can’t pull me! I was so concerned about her bolting off and injuring herself or me but the device is so sturdy and it’s short enough that she can’t pull even if she tries. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: Useful.
customer_reviews.text: This product is durable and easy to remove from the bike. I had a little problem that the Seatpost was getting twisted but after I tightened the post, the issue was no longer there. Note, If your dog isn't an active one, please do not try to run him/her on the first day. Try to Introduce your bet slowly and check their paws. I found my dog's paws were a little bit red.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul  Jama

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered item, watch seat post length for fit
customer_reviews.text: Concern over 2 issues. 1-bar is close to right heel. Danger in emergency "Bail out".I moved bar 20% backward sweep, reccomends 15%. 2-you need 2" of seat post to mount w/o getting seat too high to be able to touch the ground.. I have very active 45 lb. Vizsla, pointer/retriever.He can run 10 miles a day. I put on non-gear side. Surprise, he has taken to this well w/ only one crash. PS- make sure seat tube bolt is very tight. People w/ dogs shorter than 26" may want to add another snap to give enough length for dog. You can remove 1 or more springs allowing more length at expense of damping of exerciser. .I need damping.
customer_reviews.author: M. Belken

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to love it
customer_reviews.text: It kept squeaking and my dog was strong enough to pull me to the side and lose my balance. I wanted To love this, but didn’t work for my husky who is 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: bryan cutter

customer_reviews.title: limited shock absorption designed for trained dogs
customer_reviews.text: Did not work to absorb jerks and shocks with my exuberant husky (who runs wells alongside me). Tried product with suggested 2 springs as well as 3 springs. Adjusted product at a few different heights on the seat post. Was difficult to attach on my bike frame with provided protective rubber sleeve (with every jerk it kept rotating on the seat post). Tried both surfaces of provided sleeve before using a less smooth rubber sleeve I happened to have handy at home- which worked well.
customer_reviews.author: nita

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because of all the good ratings and it has been one of the BEST purchases I have made off amazon. I have a GSP pup and she loves to run! She took right to it and we go out 2-3 times a day. I often see people videotaping her running beside the bike. It’s easy to use and she doesn’t get tangled in the wheel or pedals like a leash would do. If your dog needs more running I highly recommend this! If I were to say one negative thing, I have to tighten up the base every few times because it moves. Other than that nothing negative.
customer_reviews.author: MB2007

customer_reviews.title: Buy It! You won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: Apart from what I paid for them, this is seriously the best purchase I have ever made for my dogs! 🤑 They both absolutely LOVE it and get so pumped to go! 🤩 And as a bonus, it wears them out in half the time of walking on a leash!! So impressed! 🚴‍♀️🐕 I walk my 85lb lab/retriever with 3 springs and my 45 lb Basset with 2. It is really easy to take a spring out but I love this walking leash so much that I just ended up getting two, so I don't have to change it for each dog. Could not be happier with this purchase. 😁
customer_reviews.author: Sommer

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly, works great!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 6 month old lab with a ton of energy and shes a puller on a leash. I bought her a nose lead which works great but she needs more exercise. I got this today and immediately put it on my bike, hooked Gracie up and off we went. I used her regular collar for this a d she did pull towards the side which to me, strains her neck. I decided to buy a halter so it does not cause her strain. Ill update my review when I use it. But for now, this is awesome. It keeps her far enough from the bike to be safe.
customer_reviews.author: DEBBIE A MOGG

customer_reviews.title: Made our daily bike rides soooo much easier
customer_reviews.text: I have a German Shepard and he needs a ton of exercise (almost as much as me). This has made our bike rides so much easier and this device keeps him at a safe distance from my bike. It’s adjustable to give to take away more slack from the included lead. I love the design and it’s super solid. The quick release makes things even better. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Courson

customer_reviews.title: Not good for a tall dog. And I can't picture how a shorter dog would work either.
customer_reviews.text: Poor design. The cord that comes off the pole is so short, what if you have a smaller dog? I have a very tall, 85lb Doberman, and this was difficult to use. I am a 5'6" female, so my bike is not set high. The attachment was set just below my seat, and my seat is at the lowest level. I had tried another brand that my neighbors have, and liked it a lot but it was out of stock when I went to purchase. Then I bought this because the reviews were not too bad. Unfortunately I missed the return window, so will be advertising it on our yardsale sites. Huge waste of money, bummer.
customer_reviews.author: SDM

customer_reviews.title: Walky Dog Bicycle Leash
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed by this product. It really works. Unlike leashes that attach to handle bars or front of the bike, with the dog tethered to the seat post, he is much less likely to make you crash if he suddenly lunges after a squirrel. The effect is more like a sudden slowing rather than a quick turn of the front wheel, followed by a crash.
customer_reviews.author: riverrnr

customer_reviews.title: Poor design prevented use.
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed. We found it difficult to mount on the bike and the device kept turning on the bike frame. We couldn’t seem to get it to tighten enough so it would remain in place. The other problem was strictly ours in that we have a large Shepard who is not good on a leash so I don’t know how I thought she would be receptive to this device. Since we could not get the device to remain in position we really didn’t get the opportunity to try. A lot of money with no results.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not for big and powerful dogs.
customer_reviews.text: I have had my original for about 7 years now. Concept is great but does not apply to big strong dogs. My 115 lbs german Shepard manages to slowly turn the locked device over a couple miles. But my 80 lbs Belgium malinois turns the locked device immediately. Most people don't have forceful dogs like this but it would be great if you had a version that had a more robust lock. I think it a great idea. I own two now but can't use them with these breeds of dogs.
customer_reviews.author: LP/OP end of the road

customer_reviews.title: Defective product?
customer_reviews.text: Broke after 2 weeks. Returned but going to try it again. Hopefully just a defect. Dog didn't pull and worked great. Again, just hoping I got a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: We absolutely love this! We have a 60lb lab / staffy mix who loves to run and needs to shed a few lbs. Neither of his humans want to run, so this is a perfect solution. We've worked up from 0.5 to 1.5 miles over several weeks and he's loving it. He does pull (cause he wants to sprint!) and it actually moves my seat, the walky dog bracket doesn't move. When you're installing it make sure you're taking turns tightening the bolts, otherwise it'll be crooked. I would recommend buying some of the mushers secret or similar paw protector - just like when a human starts running there's going to be some sore spots on their feet!
customer_reviews.author: Katie Williams

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this a handful of times now and love it. So far only going about 1.5 miles. I connected it to the frame of the bike and attach the leash to it. Leash is maybe 4ft. And works great. It’s taking some practice and before trying it out we worked on all the commands during our walk. Stop, let’s go, right, left, and leave it.
customer_reviews.author: MellowHousewife

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: I have a 10 month old 45 pound husky who would knock me off my bike whenever he would get distracted by anything and suddenly stop or turn. Let me start by saying that this product is amazing quality. It’s heavy and sturdy and you can tell without even attatching it that it will hold up for a long time. As for riding, I no longer get pulled to the side by my Husky’s sudden tugs in other directions and it keeps him safe. It was super easy to install and has made our bike riding experience so much better!
customer_reviews.author: DMSquared

customer_reviews.title: Great great great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I have a 40 lb bull terrier whippet mix, saying that she loves to run would be an understatement. I've ran her on the bike before but she would pull and react at times. This beautiful little device let's her know where I expect her to run whereas the normal leash I feel like the boundaries aren't as defined. It's super sturdy and doesnt move when she does pull. I would highly recommend for people with high energy dogs who can't keep up with them on a run to invest in this.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa M.

customer_reviews.title: Great product...with the right bike.
customer_reviews.text: We’ve had this almost a week now. I love being able to exercise my dog quickly! She has a ton of energy and pulls at the leash when walking so this is a game changer! Unfortunately, the way my bike is designed, my seat post turns so I am constantly fighting to keep her away from my front wheel. If I keep my leg locked and pressed out against the product, it works. I’ve ordered the other attachment for the wheel so we’ll see if that fixes the problem!
customer_reviews.author: T. K. Lathrom

customer_reviews.title: This thing is GREAT. I have been running my VERY energetic dog ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing is GREAT. I have been running my VERY energetic dog beside my bike for some time now, and he is a bad puller. I am constantly fighting to keep him beside the bike and not in front of it while holding his leash in my right hand, on the bike handle. This contraption keeps him just behind the pedals, and is SO MUCH SAFER than just holding the leash. I am now no longer nervous when I take him out on the bike and it is such great exercise for him. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: DeepInTheHeart

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for your bucks!
customer_reviews.text: Was gonna purchase a different brand of bicycle dog leash that cost $150 but stumbled on this one instead and haven't regretted it at all! Installation was easy (just make sure to tighten the mounting point to your bike nice and snug or it can possibly move when your dog tugs or stops) and the leash has the option of 3 lengths so it accommodate various sized dogs. When not being used on the bike the leash can detach from the bicycle mount and doubles up as a short hand held leash which makes it convenient so that you don't have to carry a second leash around when you want to stop for a walk instead.
customer_reviews.author: charlietdee

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't able to peddle with it on
customer_reviews.text: I had to put it lower on the frame because I have a seat with suspension and it didn't fit under the seat. In doing that, it was at a position where my foot hit while peddling. I had to return it. Not sure I'd feel safe riding my bike with lock in shoes ... Could be dangerous for you & the dog.
customer_reviews.author: LifeIsGood in MN

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic - Bluetick Coon dog approved!
customer_reviews.text: Our family just adopted a bluetick coon dog, age 2, with about as much energy as a rocket. I use this daily on the bike trail to run him along side me; he actually pulls me. But this product is amazing. It keeps him just the right distance away from the bike, has a solid connection, and is perfect for a dog in a harness to get the puppy energy out. Love it, love it, love it
customer_reviews.author: jcrew

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: When I first installed it, it worked OK unless my dog put on her brakes and then the entire thing would spin around. 3 weeks later it spins back and forth, and no amount of tightening has helped. My dog wasn’t way into this like others. She’s learned that if she pulls back and puts on her brakes, the bar spins back and stops the bike. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: nopenowaynohow

customer_reviews.title: Stable and fun
customer_reviews.text: Usually it takes forever to tire out my young German shepherd, now less than an hour on this thing and shes out. Tired dog = happy dog. She loves it too, I can barely touch my bike without her getting excited now. For an extra workout I let her pull me and pretty much sit back and relax, so fun for the both of us. Super stable as well, so don't worry about your dog getting distracted by other animals or anything. I highly recommend this product, we love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine.Angela

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely buy this.
customer_reviews.text: Wow I’m so glad I ordered this. It was so easy to install and took less than 5 minutes. I introduced my 85 pound German shorthair to it today. He’s 6 and has never run next to a bike. He gets exercise by chasing his ball but we can always find an open school or park to let him off in. This will make running him so much easier. He took right to it and I never felt like he was going to pull me down. He even put on the brakes to go potty and it was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amber K.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Awesome! But here’s some tips.
customer_reviews.text: This is a total game changer for exercising my dog! We attach it to his harness, not collar and I chose to add a few inches of parachord to help the fitting of it. It didn’t take him long to get use to it. A tip: when making turns toward your dog, put your leg down off your pedal and help guide your dog. This will ensure that he doesn’t hit your bike. It also helps to say LEFT LEFT just before turning or RIGHT RIGHT. It helped my dog to expect a turn. Hope that helps a little. I absolutely LOVE it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Hesitate To Purchase.
customer_reviews.text: PERFECT. I’ve been biking with my dog being on her leash and we’ve had a few close calls. She’d cross in front of me, etc. Walky Dog was the cure This product keeps “Phyllis “ safe right beside me. This is so simple to attach to the bike. I took out 2 springs to give her more leash (since she’s 6 months and can be clumsy). I cannot say enough good things about this product. It’s EXACTLY what I was looking for. Well worth the money!! It helps me change up the exercises and enrichment I give my dog, to keep her entertained. And as you can see, Phyllis is one worn out pup.
customer_reviews.author: Kelli L

customer_reviews.title: Works even better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: I just got back from my first outing with my Miniature Amercan Shepherd and the Walky Dog Plus.I was afraid tht there would be a long learning curve for her, but she took to it immediately and seeed to be really enjoying it. I even unhooked her when we came to an untraveled dirt road and she still trotted along on my right side (she just went a little faster than I had been riding).She is a high energy dog and I could walk her all day and she would still want more exercise. She's now sleeping at my feet as I type this. Mission accomplished,
customer_reviews.author: Alison S.

customer_reviews.title: All Paws In!
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 dogs love this (not all at once of course), and so do we. We have a beagle that has a TON of energy, and will run alongside our bikes beautifully with this. It does slip/rotate a little bit based on where the dog is on the bike, but I feel very safe on my bike and feel as though my dogs are safe as well. I do wish the lead was a little bit longer, but thankfully we have a short handheld leash that we attach to it to extend it by about 5-6 more inches. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Dog_Crazd

customer_reviews.title: My border collie loves it!  Hence so do I.
customer_reviews.text: This is just the tool I needed for running my border collie. I had to shift it down from my seatpost to the seat tube, however, to keep it from brushing my thigh as I pedaled. I ride a cyclocross bike and I think this product would be more suited to a hybrid or cruiser style bike where ones legs are in a more forward pedaling position. Still, I love the product and would (already have) recommended it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Ukukat

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product...highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This product is awesome! I have a 60 pound husky mix who loves to run and this is by far the best way to do it. He runs at full speed (25 mph) and there has never been any kind of an issue with the product holding up. The extra strength bungee is also great for if he tugs in one direction or the other as it is very forgiving for the bike rider. I have thee of these (one for each bike in the house) and will be a customer for life.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: She seemed to love it and caught on very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a couple months ago and finally got an Ezydog harness for my dog. My recommendation is to definitely get a harness if you were to use this product. I took my American Pitbull Terrier (high energy dog) out once the harness arrived. She seemed to love it and caught on very quickly. I do plan on getting a Y-leash attachment and another harness so I can also take my Rott/Lab mix out. I do definitely recommend this product if you have a high energy dog. Start off with short distances so to get them used to it. I would recommend getting something to protect the pads of their feet.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Pretty great.
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been a lifesaver. I have a trike that I love and couldnt figure out how to run my dogs. This thing WORKS!!! My only issue with it is no matter how tight I get it on my seat post, one of my dogs will occasionally manage to pull it forward a little and then it's hitting my leg. I dont know if maybe I am doing something wrong. Otherwise, it has been great. I did buy small adapters to lengthen the part that clips to my dogs so they would be well out of the way of my pedals.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Elliott

customer_reviews.title: Works well with my 25 pound Shiba Inu
customer_reviews.text: So I have had this now for a couple of months. Shinji loves biking with me. Hes smaller than the recommended size so I mounted it a bit lower on my bike and it works perfectly fine there! Never slips around. The rope has just enough tension. Hes never gotten injured on any of the rides we've gone on. I take him biking with this at least 5 times a week. I highly recommend it. The latch to secure onto the bracket is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Silva

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with the purchase and would recommend it to others
customer_reviews.text: Works as described. When I told people I had ordered this item, their first response was "isn't your dog going to pull you off from your bicycle?" I had no such trouble. The bar keeps my 50 lb. American Pit Bull Terrier mix just the right distance from my bike, and he ambles alongside. I bought this because Joel is a high energy dog who was not getting enough exercise. I am very happy with the purchase and would recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Houdini

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best product for our high energy pup!! Our dog thinks my version of “running” is super lame. She was SO excited I found a contraption that lets her really run at her pace. She is so fast that I actually have to work pretty hard to keep up with her even on her bike! But, the protection pole keeps her away from the tires and the bungee cord gives her some leeway so she doesn’t get choked when we’re not perfectly in sync. We ride our bikes to drop the kids off at at school each morning and pick them up each afternoon and my pup has never been happier ❤️
customer_reviews.author: Mama of 2

customer_reviews.title: Has all the features I was looking for. Love it!
customer_reviews.text: We like it! It's simple to install, secure, sturdy, and easy to adjust the length of the cord by removing a spring or two. I like that this one doesn't have an emergency breakaway feature like others do because my little guy is a runner and if he came detached, he'd take off and I can't have that. The bar is easy to detach from the mount for taking a break from your ride or for storage. I have no complaints. I've had it for a month and used it 3 or 4 times. I will update if needed down the line. If no updates, assume I still love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kaycee

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING!
customer_reviews.text: My 70+ lb pitbull mix dog hates being on leash but loves running. He can certainly pull. I was a little nervous about riding with him on leash but this thing was great! He did a few full stops from a run on our first ride (i figured there would be a learning curve) and I didnt fall off my bike! Great device for any owner who wants to spend more quality time with there puppers.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for a High Energy Dog
customer_reviews.text: This setup works really well for our pup. We started with 5 min runs and worked up to 25 min at a time with short stops every other day or so. I worried that there might be confusion when we turn or when she sees something she wants to stop for, but I always make sure she’s pooped before we go, and it didn’t take long for us to communicate about turning.
customer_reviews.author: kendrakw

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: It was pretty simple to install. It is great for our big dogs, not so good for our little ones. Ive tightened it quite a bit, but my dogs still seem to move the position. It is easy to move back, just a bit annoying. After I installed it, I did a practice test in my backyard. Each of my dogs caught on pretty quick. We love this!! I would def recommend it :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer Sandra Manning

customer_reviews.title: Great for my active dog!
customer_reviews.text: Likes: Easy attach and detach from the mounting bracket; don't need to carry a separate leash; solid design that makes replacing the paracord (if ever needed) easy; my Vizsla loves going for a bike ride, and now, I can keep up with her so much better than walking! Dislikes: Less "stretch" than I expected; but, that's a very small issue compared to the benefit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected -- very well made
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my golf cart. I was surprised that it easily fit to a support on the cart-- no adjustments needed. I will be working with my dog to accept being next to the cart with me walking beside him. Then hopefully he will adjust to a nice pace and I can ride IN the cart!! I recommend this as it is very well made and easily taken on or off the cart (or bicycle).
customer_reviews.author: Sue

customer_reviews.title: Bring extra leash with you
customer_reviews.text: The product is great overall. Just want to caution anyone that might get this to still bring a real leash with in case you and your dog need to walk home for whatever reason. Mine doggo loves the run, but he will always be a bit skittish of the bike. I wish the mount had some kind of quick release. And maybe if the lead length was adjustable somehow.
customer_reviews.author: Addicted Ninja Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Love, love, love. Started hesitant and now can’t live without it!!
customer_reviews.text: I was VERY nervous about this. My 10 month old puppy is very reactive. She runs, and I mean, run at people, cars, dogs, etc. This product at all is amazing! I barely feel a thing when she tries to go for anything. It might be like a small “tug”. I am not a strong biker and I just keep moving. Turning is great! My puppy is 50lbs of pure muscle and she isn’t going anywhere with this thing. TOTALLY RECOMMEND IT!
customer_reviews.author: Leah M

customer_reviews.title: I really do like this, but my bike post (where it attaches) ...
customer_reviews.text: I really do like this, but my bike post (where it attaches) is fairly large. This makes me attach it to my seat post, and when my dog tries to avoid moving forward, he sits and the seat post turns. I can pedal harder to make him move forward, but my seat stays crooked. It's not that big of a deal, but I would like to be able to find post attachment bolts that are a little longer. I then could attach it to my larger post where it wouldn't affect my seat. Other than wanting longer bolts, the product is great!
customer_reviews.author: Angie P.

customer_reviews.title: Walky Dog has tamed our wild child
customer_reviews.text: WOW we are so pleased. I say we as in myself, my wife and our little dog Izzy. Super impressed with the design. Real quality. Super easy to install. I used the clamp for my wife’s bike and I ordered the mount for the tire axel for my bike. Adjusting the cord length was as easy as tying and untying a knot. We have a wild child with tons of energy. She can’t wait to get out on her walkydog. Since we’ve been taking her on her run she’s a much calmer wild child. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who has a wild child of their own as it is well worth the price!
customer_reviews.author: PJHANSON

customer_reviews.title: An excellant product
customer_reviews.text: I read many other reviews before deciding to purchase this walker. Our dog picked it up quickly and I have only crashed once, which was my fault. Our dog is an Australian Sheppard (wonderful dog) and she picked it right up. Its good for exercise, but not the same as a leisurely walk where she gets to smell everything, so we mix it up. At times we exercise and get rid of energy, then other times when on the leash, she gets to "run" us as she chases what ever they smell.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: the dog enjoys plenty of attention
customer_reviews.text: works great, dog hasn't run into the tire yet, he outgrew some harnesses, eventually became so strong he'd twist the seat stem that it was secured too... if anything that's all I would do is move it to somewhere else - the bike is a Trek hybrid, so the frame isn't easily attached too, but the seat pole is still ok, just have to slow him down a little
customer_reviews.author: JCrain

customer_reviews.title: Great for a high energy dog
customer_reviews.text: Best thing ever for a high energy dog that is bored easily and digs holes in your lawn. Just a few minutes on a bike running his guts out and he's worn out. You do have to steer them a bit with your foot to keep them from running into the bike when you turn unless they are great at recognizing voice commands for left and right. My dog doesn't like that he can't run off and sniff things but the point is to expend energy quickly. He can take a leisurely walk afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: J Smith

customer_reviews.title: Has kept my dog from killing me on my bike
customer_reviews.text: Really like this as my dog runs and zig zags all over the place and trying to ride a bike while holding his leash was pretty much a death wish. The only complaint is that it is just a tiny bit to short and holds him to close to the bike which freaks him out. I lenthened the rope by about six inches which gave him a little distance from the bike but is still short enough to keep him from going in front of the bike. I have a doggy trailer on the back of my bike for my non athletic dog and now all three of us can go for a ride together.
customer_reviews.author: Krissy

customer_reviews.title: just get it!
customer_reviews.text: simply put, if you own a bicycle and a dog owns you, you should get this. I used it for the first time today and my dog is still getting used to it, but it is already worth every penny. its a super sturdy build and is really easy to use/ mount. my dog stays by my side and even when he tries to yank, the bike stays on the road with me on it. this is an excellent piece of equipment and will ensure that i can get some of that excess energy out of my woofer.
customer_reviews.author: chicookai

customer_reviews.title: Safest way to give my dog the exercise he needs.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the product, so does my dog! and everyone that sees it asks where I got it. When I bought it I saw a couple similar attachments but the heavy duty construction is what sold me on this design. (My dog is big and he has a bad habit of chasing squirrels) The design is great, it allowed me to lengthen the paracord a bit and choose the color I wanted as well. I did have an issue with the lower attachment, but the company fixed it quickly and really made me happy I did buy this product from an American source.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Grace

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: We love this to use on our bikes with our 2 boys. The only complaint I would have is that the lead even fully extended is too short for dogs under 25#. It puts them too close to bike and mine don’t like it. I bought an extension and it works wonders. Love the quick release for on and off and use it as leash when off bike.
customer_reviews.author: Paula M

customer_reviews.title: If your dog is hyperactive, do not get this
customer_reviews.text: Whenever my dog sees another dog, he jumps and pulls my bike, mind he's only a 37 lbs husky. When my dog pulls the leash bar, it loosens every time no matter how hard I screw it up. Also, my dog likes to run from left to right. This may not be for you if you prefer your dog to have the mobility to run on either side of you.
customer_reviews.author: SimpleAndClean

customer_reviews.title: Love this product!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this product!! I have a 65 lb German Shepherd with boundless energy. I had never taken her riding with me before. She took to the whole bike thing and Walky Dog attachment with no issues whatsoever. She pulled hard one time after seeing a squirrel she wanted to chase but the cord seems to act as a shock absorber and I had no problem maintaining control of the bike and her. I highly recommend it. A fantastic time saver to exercise my dog quickly. I also bought the Urban Trail fleece lined dog harness that I attach her to the Walky Dog with.
customer_reviews.author: Tamiga

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I use this to get my 80lb pitbull's energy out. I use to hold his leash while attempting to steer my bike but this is much safer. I have attached it to the seat pole so it is grounded under my weight. He cannot pull me in any direction I don't want to go and I have both hands for breaking and steering. He's a very strong dog and I feel completely comfortable exercising him using this
customer_reviews.author: ryan

customer_reviews.title: My 125 pound dog & I love this!
customer_reviews.text: My 125 pound dog & I love this! It takes a little getting used to. I have to be very self-aware while riding with my large dog attached. It's more of an issue when he decides to STOP, than the distractions you'd expect { squirrels, people, other dogs }. I've been using it for a few months, never fell, never a problem. It just takes a little bit to get used to. My dog certainly now has a way to run fast and release some of that built-up energy!
customer_reviews.author: C. Peter Zuroff

customer_reviews.title: I have a GSP...
customer_reviews.text: My GSP can run miles. This attachment helps her exercise and keeps me in shape too. I bought another one for my other bike too
customer_reviews.author: Mark Borzecki

customer_reviews.title: GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: This is the greatest tool for an active dog. This is the second one I've had and I needed a new one because the old one finally just wore out! I tell everyone I know about this. I dog sit the neighbors' dogs and all the larger active ones love it when they come to my house. So many large dogs end up sitting in houses and not enjoying life. l feel so bad for them. It is a sturdy piece of equipment. The old one is still usable, but after over 10 yrs it just felt safer to have a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Mac

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have For High Energy Dogs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 month old Belgian Malinois as the 2 mile walk was not doing the trick. She picked it up on the first ride and we have been doing 3 miles every night for 4 weeks now. She loves the intense 14 minute run and I love the fact it burns off tons of energy where she now sleeps all night. I first saw this in use by my neighbor who had the higher price unit that was around $150 but he confirmed as so the reviews that model was a pain to re-install after not being in use. I chose this cheaper option with the quick disconnect and could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: BSmith

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Honestly one of the best purchases I have made in a while. It keeps her away from the wheels but still close enough I can pass people on a trail. Since the bars sits at my center of gravity I do not worry about loosing my balance when she pulls sideways. I would recommend putting your dog in a harness for this to help keep pressure off of their necks. If you are considering a way to exercise your dog besides walking or jogging, I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes our rides so much nicer!
customer_reviews.text: This is so excellent! Works great for my Vizsla to run along side of me! He took to it immediately and we are enjoying our bike rides every morning together even more! It is safer for him and for me as well and that’s exactly what I was looking for! Now I don’t have to hold on to a leash and he can’t get in front of my tire or behind me.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Rope inside broke
customer_reviews.text: It works for my 70 lb puppy doberman. However it did not last. Where do I get a new rope that goes inside the metal?It has broken off.
customer_reviews.author: laura

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn' work...it won't grip the stem of the bike. If my dogs stopped the pole went with them. No good directions to troubleshoot either. This product should have the things so it will properly on all bikes and stems.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: and I can easily take it on and off
customer_reviews.text: I have tried everything before buying this, all the cheap DIY ideas: bungee cords attached to my seat and to my rack, PVC pipe with a rope and bungee in it, waist harnesses... nothing was feasible considering my dog is reactive and will pull hard if another dog runs up to us. With this I can ride my bike with her, she doesn't get in the way of my tires, it absorbs shock, and I can easily take it on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Sorrel Robinson

customer_reviews.title: It works......
customer_reviews.text: I have a 100 lb "puppy". He needed exercise and after reading reviews and watching videos I decided to try out the device. All I can say is I'm so glad I did! My dog Rex really loves the runs. I was worried he would shy away from the bike but just like in the videos he took to it after a very short prep. I walked him several blocks while attached to the bike so he could acclimate to it. He was off and running in no time at all! We average 3.5 miles a day at an 11 mph. I'm extremely satisfied with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Downing

customer_reviews.title: Love these!!!
customer_reviews.text: I love that they reached out to ensure I didn’t accidentally purchase two. My dogs LOVE these and so do we! I don’t even need to pedal if I don’t want to as my older husky can pull me and it’s not an unstable pull. You would think he was right in front. They enjoy their beautiful run and are ready for bed when we get home. ❤️
customer_reviews.author: L Darrah

customer_reviews.title: he loved the pace
customer_reviews.text: I cannot rave about this product more. I was VERY skeptical but I cannot feel my 55 lb coon hound tugging at all. He picked up on the concept WAY faster than I would have expected. I feel stable on the bike, he loved the pace, and I'm just elated. It's rare that a product out performs expectations, but if you are hesitant about the price, I whole-heartedly urge you to try it. Also, I'm very not mechanically inclined and it was a cinch to install. Would recommend to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Margules

customer_reviews.title: Doggy mama is in love!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dogs. I have a blue heeler/rottie mix. He is 70 lbs of energy. He frequently pulls my 250lb hubby off his feet. If he sees a dog, cat or squirrel- he’s gone. Not with this though. When he tried to go sideways it kept him in check and I barely felt it. And he is finally tired! A month long high priced school didn’t do what this exercise did for him. I have had numerous dogs and highly recommend this. No I was not paid, nor did I get it free.
customer_reviews.author: PatienceBlue

customer_reviews.title: It's not bad!
customer_reviews.text: It's not bad. This is the second style I've used and honestly, I think if this was the first style I tried I would like it more. I only decided to keep this one because my current dog doesn't pull, but I don't think I would trust this not to throw off my balance if he decided to bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Our Golden Doodle learned to use this quickly.
customer_reviews.text: Our Golden Doodle goes 1-1.5 miles beside the bike most days. Even when he sees a bunny or another dog and pulls, we have never felt insecure on the bike. He's almost 70 lbs, but it is easy to counter balance his occasional pulls to the side and not feel in danger or off balance.
customer_reviews.author: Cecebe Girl

customer_reviews.title: Great but doesn’t last
customer_reviews.text: I loved this product minus the most important feature the connection to the bike. A Bearing fell out as soon as I open the box eventually lost the other two within a month and it no longer connects to the bike and can’t find replacement part for just that piece.
customer_reviews.author: AndyP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect tool for bringing your dog along!
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this so that we could have our dog run alongside us when we go biking. It was super easy to install and has been working really well over the last year. The clip is attached to a little Bungie string that has a lot of give so you don't jerk the dog around too much. We have used this product for over a year and it is still working very well.
customer_reviews.author: John Robert Gledhill

customer_reviews.title: Not for use with beach cruiser bikes.
customer_reviews.text: So, this product is such a great idea! The only issue I had with it is that my bike is a beach cruiser. The only place to attach the bar ends up being too close to the pedal. I've tried adjusting it and making it work to no avail. My calf ends up hitting it every time. This is an awesome product, but I would not recommend for a beach cruiser.
customer_reviews.author: KV

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 50 & 60 pound huskies!
customer_reviews.text: Just got mine today, went out for bike rides and it went great! Normally I would tie a leash to the front of my bike to ride, but it’s too dangerous and when they would pull I would go with it. With this I barley felt when they pulled, plus they didn’t even want to pull as much as the do on a leash. I used it with my 80 & 50 pound husky. I used a clip for extra security. It rest under your thigh when you sit on your bike, but once you start riding you don’t notice it. Love this, looking forward to using this from now on!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle M Eatmon

customer_reviews.title: Must own!!
customer_reviews.text: How am I just learning about these!! I bike with my two border collies daily and one tends to pull like he’s attached to a dog sled for the first five minutes. This has been the solution I have always needed and makes riding two dogs on a bike a breeze with a simple splitter. The quick release is genius and makes for a very reliable connection
customer_reviews.author: Myles O'Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: Works really great so far - only wish the length of the leash was a bit adjustable, but it's definitely not a problem, still 5 stars from me! The reviews are accurate, really excited to have a whole new way to tire out my doggo! Walked my bike with my dog attached at first, then lowered my seat so I could keep my feet on the ground while he pulled, after that we were comfortable and ready to go - he seems to love it 😁
customer_reviews.author: AshWay

customer_reviews.title: I recommend it for use with a back harness
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended. I use it without the scuff guard. Using it with that guard made it sick enough to turn around the seat post. I purchased this as an affordable way to see how well my dog likes to run alongside me as I bike. I recommend it for use with a back harness. I also suggest using a lead as a back up. My dog manages to slip every harness we've tried, including the ruffwear front range harness. Also, while a front harness gives more control, it pulls on the harness and makes it easier for my dog to slip out.
customer_reviews.author: Ally

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool for riding a bike with your dog
customer_reviews.text: This tool is amazing! I have a weimaraner who has a lot of energy. This gives me the ability to ride my bike while my dog gets some exercise running. We both love it! The spring prevents him for pulling me over. We ride smoothly and easily. I have no issues. Feels super sturdy and easily connects and disconnects.
customer_reviews.author: Renee Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Awesome way to give the dog exercise
customer_reviews.text: My Vizsla loves our bikes rides with the Walky Dog. Hes super high energy and sometimes this is the only way to give him the exercise he needs. Even off leash hikes aren't enough at times. A bike ride is a never fail. He sets the pace. At first your dog may be skittish about the bike being so close. Take him for a few walks attached to the bike before doing a ride.
customer_reviews.author: Deacon Blues

customer_reviews.title: Great for high energy dogs
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. Totally changed the way I can exercise my dog. With two kids and a 1.5 y.o. lab it is high priority to get him out. I attached this to my bike that also has a baby trailer. I take him and my 1 y.o. baby out for rides without a problem. The other day we were going downhill and he darted after a squirrel. I felt the tug but did not lose any control over the bike the trailer or the dog. Recommend for anyone with a high energy dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love This!
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical about spending $65 for this when I found cheaper options. This thing is AWESOME! Installation is SUPER easy even if the directions are in 234 different languages, and I love the snap on/snap off feature. It sits under my seat and I never have to worry about it. My dog is also smaller. He's 15 pounds so when I first installed it I figured it would choke my dog forever. Fortunately, I read the directions and learned that it comes with 3 springs inside. All you have to do is unscrew the end and pull out the springs so that the leash portion can hang lower. I pulled 2 out and now it's perfect length!
customer_reviews.author: Yaz

product_meta.title: Walky Dog Plus Hands Free Dog Bicycle Exerciser Leash Newest Model with 550-lbs Pull Strength Paracord Leash Military Grade
feature_bullets: Patented design includes an internal shock-absorbing system and quick lock and release capability for easy switching between bikes
High Carbon Stainless steel for strength leash installs on virtually any bike in under 5 minutes Only True Quick Release Bike leash Patented design
Lets you safely walk your dog and ride your bike at the same time Length of Leash is Adjustable Can add 6.5 Inches by taking out 2 springs inside the Steel Wand that will allow extra leash length
Leash Has Military Grade Paracord 550-lbs pull strength, 7 strand Inner core 5/32 -4mm diameter, uv fade resistant & rot resistant

For high energy Medium to large dogs we designed walky dog specifically for boxers, huskies, Golden Retrievers, Labradors, and all Other medium Large high energy dogs. The oversized hardware and 500lb pull strength leash are built for extreme durability and will easily handle the largest dogs

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
